knowledge.title: Bob the Mechanic
knowledge.description: Troubleshoot your car with Bob before taking it to a mechanic!

goal.name: identified_problem
goal.description: These are potential problems with your car.
goal.answer: The alternator is not working properly, it is likely not re-charging the battery anymore. Therefore, your car might not have enough electricity to keep running, maintain the AC system or even start!
The battery is too low and needs to be charged.
The battery and the alternator seem fine. It might be that the electric motor is broken. I suggest taking it to a mechanic to be sure!
The battery has a low level of electrolytes. Try adding more according to the battery manufacturer or take it to an electrician!
The battery has fully discharged and has produced irreparable damage. It needs to be replaced.
The key is not recognised by the car. Try taking it to a mechanic to reprogram it.
The battery of your smart key is very low. Try replacing it or placing the key very close to the Start button.
The car seems fine... Perhaps there are wiring problems. I recommend taking it to a mechanic to have a look at it!
The clutch cable is broken. I recommend changing it with a new one.
The gearbox oil is too old and too viscous to allow the gearbox to move. Replace it!
The gearbox oil has leaked too much and might not be enough to allow the car to move. I suggest taking it to a mechanic to discover where the leak is coming from!
Given you have a manual car, there might be a problem with the clutch disk or the planetary gear. You should check both at a mechanic!
Given that you have an automatic car, the only thing left that can be wrong is the planetary gear. This is not easy to look at yourself and, therefore, I recommend taking it to a mechanic!
There is or might be a flat tyre. This can cause the steering wheel to vibrate, make it harder to turn or make the wheels deteriorate faster. Get it replaced yourself or take it to a nearby mechanic!
There is a loose bolt on one of the tyres. This can create a noise from one of them and is dangerous! Tighten them all using the car's tools.
The brake plates are deteriorated and should be replaced. Driving with such plates is dangerous and should be done as soon as possible!
One or more of the wheel bearings are deteriorated, most likely because they were not properly oiled.

answer.value: Personal items or a piece is loose

goal.answer: A personal item is moving freely or a car component is not tightened properly. Investigate further or, if you're concerned, take it to a mechanic.
The wheels need to be changed after 8 years of use! It is normal to show signs of wear after such a long time.
If you drive often on gravel roads, the wheels will wear down very fast! The gravel is very slippery and acts like a sandpaper for your tires, thus making them show signs of wear early.
You need to use the tyre pressure indicated by the manufacturer! This ensures that the tyres have a longer life and provides more security overall on the road.
Driving in the city makes you brake often. This makes your tires wear down fast.
If you break often and abruptly, your wheels will wear down quickly. I suggest driving safer and avoiding pressing the brake pedal too hard.
A pothole or a similar obstacle might have thrown your wheels out of alignment. This is very dangerous and should be taken to a mechanic to adjust the toe-in angle!
Change the air filters regularly to reduce fuel consumption. You should be changing them when you also change the oil, roughly every 10.000-15.000 km.
Change the fuel filters regularly to reduce fuel consumption. You should be changing them half as often as you change the oil, roughly every 15.000 km.
There is an issue with a spark plug. It is likely worn out or the sensor wiring is faulty.
Use the appropriate gears when driving to reduce consumption. If the problem persists, go to a mechanic.
Avoid accelerating suddenly to reduce consumption. If the problem persists, go to a mechanic.
Your car seems to be taken care of! I suspect that there might be a problem with the injection pump, but I suggest taking it to a mechanic to be sure!
The coolant is too old to maintain the temperature of your car. I recommend changing it!
The coolant is leaking somewhere and is not enough to maintain the car at a low temperature. I suggest taking the car to a mechanic to identify the leak and fix it!
There is not enough oil in the engine! This can increase the friction between the pieces inside and and, therefore, increase the temperature. Try to add more or change the engine oil!
The car seems to be fine so far! I suspect that the cooling fan in the front is broken! This can prevent the car from lowering its temperature. I suggest taking it to a mechanic to be sure!
This issue is more common in older cars, in hot environments. When using the AC system, the radiator and its fan can't keep up, causing the car to overheat. Try opening the windows!
As your car is new, it should handle various environments, including hot ones! I suspect that there might be a faulty thermostat, but you should take it to a mechanic to be sure!
The handbrake is pulled! This blocks the wheels and makes the car stall (especially when the engine is cold).
There is not enough gas in the tank! Make sure to fill it up, otherwise other car parts might become faulty.
The engine is not lubrciated enough due to a lack of oil. Make sure to add enough, based on the dipstick.
I suspect that the wheels are blocked, due to a faulty handbrake cable. I suggest taking it to a mechanic or releasing the brakes yourself.
The freon is too old to maintain a lower temperature! I suggest taking it to a mechanic to change it.
The AC compressor is broken and cannot circulate the freon properly. I suggest changing it with a new one!
The power steering oil is too old and viscous to allow the steering wheel to turn normally. I suggest changing it with a new one!
The power steering oil is leaking and, therefore, not enough to turn the steering wheel properly! I suggest taking it to a mechanic to identify the leak and fix it.
I cannot identify what is wrong with your car. I recommend taking it to a mechanic and checking everything there!

option.description: It starts, but it does not move.

The coolant temperature is too high.
The air conditioner does not work properly.
The steering wheel feels hard to turn/stiff.

option.description: It sounds like it is starting (cranks), but it fails.

option.description: I changed it 2 to 3 years ago.
I have not changed it for more than 3 years.

option.description: Yes, but less than five hours.
Yes, for more than five hours.
